moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 b5: Wasnt expecting b5 at all. Pretty premature
moves.5. Bb3 Nf6 6. O-O d6 7. d3: Out of book. I think Ng5 was book. Removes threat on e4
moves.9. h3: Trying to kick out the Bishop
moves.10. g4: Forces Bishop Bg6 which locks in his Bishop
moves.11... Nh5 12. Bd5: Pins blacks knight at c6. Threatens Bxc6+ winning the Rook.
moves.12... Qd7: Defends c6 Threatens Qxh3 putting pressure on my king
moves.13. Qd2 f6:
This is probably his mistake. Doesn't completely put him out but leads to 14.Qc3 Nd4 15.Bxd4 Nf4
16.Qxc6 Rb8 17.gxf6 Bxf6 18.Be3 Nxh3+ Which leaves him down two pawns.
I think Better was Rb8 leading to 14.Bxc6 Qxc6 15.Nc3  h6 16.Nh4 Bh7 17.Nd5 hxg5 18.Bxg5 Which is an equal exchange
moves.14. Qc3 O-O-O: Leads to 15.Bxc6 Qxh3 16.Qa5 Rdf8 17.Qxa6+ Kd8 18.Qxb5 Qg4+ 19.Kh2 fxg5 20.Qb8+ Qc8 21.Qxc8+ Kxc8 22.Bxg5 Bxg5 23.Nxg5, which wins a queen, a bishop, and two pawns for a queen, a knight, and three pawns. Better is Nd4, leading to 15.Bxd4 Nf4 16.Qc6 Rb8 17.gxf6 Bxf6 18.Be3 Nxh3+ 19.Kh1, which wins two pawns for a knight and a pawn.
moves.15. Bxc6 Qxh3 16. Qa5 Rdf8: Putting more Pressure on my knight at f3.
moves.23... Rxf3: Black becomes greedy and steps into forced mate in 7.
Enjoy! Don't hesitate to leave any comments on my game!
